author: Stephen Brumwell
title: ‘Gibraltar’ Review: When the Rock Was a Hard Place
text:
In September 1944, at the height of World War II, Prime Minister Winston Churchill issued an extraordinary directive. Despite his many other distractions, Churchill was concerned about the dwindling population of Barbary macaque monkeys on the Rock of Gibraltar, where a British naval base stood guard over the narrow straits linking the Mediterranean and the Atlantic. According to legend, as long as the monkeys remained on Gibraltar, so would the British. Alive to the importance of maintaining wartime morale, Churchill ordered that no effort be spared to bolster their numbers.
Gibraltar...
